conclusion: Changing magnetic field induces potential difference between points a and b.
Problem involves electromagnetic induction and Faraday's law.
Magnetic field covers half of the square frame and is directed into the paper.
Area of half the square experiencing magnetic flux change is 0.02 mÂ².
Rate of change of magnetic flux is 0.2 Wb/s.
Induced EMF according to Faraday's law is -0.2 V.
Negative sign in EMF indicates opposition to change in magnetic flux.
Potential difference between points a and b is 0.2 V.
Direction of potential difference depends on current flow direction.
Points a and b are at edges of region where magnetic field changes.
Current flows clockwise, making potential at point a higher than at point b.
Final potential difference is 0.2 V with point a at higher potential.
